page.title: 04Traditions
page.content: Preesall and Knott-End Gala used to be held on a Bank Holiday Monday but is now on the second Saturday in July.It has run for over fifty years apart from the war years.After the war the British Legion took responsibility for much of the organisation.The process- ion still stops for the retiring Queen to lay a bouquet of flowers at the War Memorial.The Gala has always taken the form of a procession of floats and trailers. The present custom of various organisations entering floats contrasts with earlier practice in which each street decorated a trailer. The procession is often accompanied by Pilling Jubilee Silver Band.After the judging of the floats, fancy-dress, etc we make our way to the Gala Field for sports and entertainment.At the end of the afternoon the children of the village are given a free tea.
